verb.description: Disgust or sicken (someone) with an excess of sweetness, richness, or sentiment.
examples: the first long sip gives a malty taste that never cloys
a curious bittersweetness that cloyed her senses

origin: Late Middle English: shortening of obsolete accloy stop up, choke, from Old French encloyer drive a nail into, from medieval Latin inclavare, from clavus a nail.
